intro: Microstachys sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaved microstachys, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and sessile leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
